s.text: Written by Linus Torvalds, a Finnish programmer who couldn't afford to buy a commercial operating system, Linux is free, is maintained by a vast network of loyal volunteer programmers, and never crashes.

The magazine profiles Metropolitan Opera General Manager Joseph Volpe, who began his career as a set-building carpenter and now rules the institution with workmanlike practicality and a diva-sized temper.

"We're far from certain that her brand of righteous liberalism is what the people of New York want or need," say the editors, "but we are sure that it would be healthy for the country to find out."
